titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that James Brown, also known as the "Godfather of Soul", should be recognized for his contributions to American music as one of the greatest and most influential entertainers of the 1950s, 1960s, and 1970s as an American cultural icon.

Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that James Brown, also known as the "Godfather of Soul", should be recognized for his contributions to American music as one of the greatest and most influential entertainers of the 1950s, 1960s, and 1970s as an American cultural icon.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Healthy Families and Communities.

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of Congress that James Brown should be recognized for his contributions as an American musical icon.
